title: SpaceX Working On 'Marslink' To Offer Full Mars Surface Real Time Connectivity
summary: SpaceX Working On 'Marslink' To Offer Full Mars Surface Real Time Connectivity

title: Crew-8 astronauts remain mum about post-splashdown medical issue
summary: The three NASA astronauts who returned to Earth on the Crew-8 mission declined to discuss the medical issue that prompted a trip to the hospital after their return and, for one of them, an overnight stay.

title: SpaceX's Dragon Completes First ISS Reboost, Demonstrating SpaceX’s Expanding Capabilities
summary: SpaceX's Dragon Completes First ISS Reboost, Demonstrating SpaceX’s Expanding Capabilities

title: Santa Maria to be Landing Site of Inaugural Space Rider Flight
summary: The Portuguese Space Agency announced 8 November that the island of Santa Maria has been chosen as the landing site for the inaugural flight of Space Rider. Space Rider is an eight-metre reusable orbital vehicle designed to serve as a robotic laboratory in orbit, enabling scientific research and technology demonstrations. The vehicle is capable of […]

title: Crew-8 Will Reveal Hospitalization Details “In Fullness of Time”
summary: The three NASA Crew-8 astronauts who returned to Earth last month firmly declined to answer questions today about who was hospitalized and why after splashdown. Astronaut Michael Barratt, a physician...

title: Sols 4357–4358: Turning West
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2024 Sols 4357–4358: Turning West If you’ve ever driven down a road that’s in need of repaving, you’ll know that it can be an uncomfortable experience. The same is true on Mars: even at our carefully slow driving speed, the rough, rocky terrain that we’ve found ourselves in since […]

title: Ex-Google exec attracts financial backers for LEO megaconstellation
summary: Logos Space has early financial commitments needed to deploy 1,000 satellites for global broadband coverage, according to the former Google executive behind the one-year-old megaconstellation startup.

title: NASA Ames Astrogram – September/October 2024
summary: TIME Recognizes the Advanced Composite Solar Sail System In October, the Advanced Composite Solar Sail System a project managed at NASA Ames, was recognized by TIME Magazine as a “Top Invention of 2024”! TIME Magazine also recognized two other NASA missions this year: Europa Clipper, and the Deep Space Optical Communications experiment.    The Advanced Composite Solar […]

title: Next Ariane 6 launch slips to early 2025
summary: The second flight of Europe’s Ariane 6 rocket, and its first commercial mission, has slipped from December to no earlier than mid-February, Arianespace announced Nov. 8.

title: PLD Space unveils ambitious plan for the next decade
summary: PLD Space unveiled an aggressive 10-year plan last month at the company’s new headquarters building in Elche, Spain. This plan will begin by upgrading its under-development Miura 5 rocket with propulsive landing capability, which will aid in introducing a whole new family of rockets.
